name: Intermediate Restaurant Training
scenarioContext: You're dining at a moderately upscale restaurant with a professional service style. The waiter is efficient and expects you to communicate your needs clearly, but will provide helpful information when asked.
initialDialogue: Good evening. I'll be your server tonight. Have you had a chance to look at the menu?
allergyTips: Speak clearly about your allergies - professional waiters expect direct communication
Ask specific questions about ingredients and preparation methods
Don't expect excessive guidance - take initiative in your safety questioning
Be prepared to make decisions based on the information provided
positiveReinforcements: I'll make note of that allergy for the kitchen.
Good question - let me get you that information.
I can certainly have that prepared without those ingredients.
That's a sensible choice given your dietary requirements.
gentlePrompts: Do you have any dietary requirements I should be aware of?
Would you like me to go through the ingredients in that dish?
Are there any modifications you'd like me to request from the kitchen?
